For whom wilt thou name as an instance? The king? Not even he liveth a life free from care, but one burdened with much tribulation and anxiety. For look not to his diadem, but to his sea of cares, by which trouble is produced for him. Nor look to his purple robe, but to his soul, which is darker than that purple.
